benchmark_details.name: MedFact
benchmark_details.overview: MedFact is a new benchmark for evaluating the fact-checking capabilities of large language models on Chinese medical texts. It includes 2,116 expert-annotated instances covering 13 medical specialties and aims to assess the models' performance on veracity classification and error localization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously evaluate the factual reliability of large language models in the domain of Chinese medical texts.

data.source: Curated from diverse real-world texts including medical encyclopedias and consultation websites.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model predictions compared to expert annotations.
methodology.interpretation: High scores represent accurate veracity classification and successful identification of error spans.
methodology.baseline_results: Human experts provide baseline performance metrics.
methodology.validation: Performance validated against a human expert baseline.
